dbq_name: Respiratory Conditions (Other than Tuberculosis and Sleep Apnea)

rating_overview.description: Respiratory conditions are rated primarily based on pulmonary function test (PFT) results

levels.criteria: FEV-1 of 71-80% predicted, or FEV-1/FVC of 71-80%, or intermittent inhalational or oral bronchodilator therapy
FEV-1 of 56-70% predicted, or FEV-1/FVC of 56-70%, or daily inhalational or oral bronchodilator therapy, or inhalational anti-inflammatory medication

FEV-1 of 40-55% predicted, or FEV-1/FVC of 40-55%, or at least monthly visits to a physician for required care of exacerbations, or intermittent (at least three per year) courses of systemic (oral or parenteral) corticosteroids

FEV-1 less than 40% predicted, or FEV-1/FVC less than 40%, or more than one attack per week with episodes of respiratory failure, or requires daily use of systemic (oral or parenteral) high dose corticosteroids or immuno-suppressive medications
FEV-1 of 71-80% predicted, or FEV-1/FVC of 71-80%, or DLCO (SB) of 66-80% predicted
FEV-1 of 56-70% predicted, or FEV-1/FVC of 56-70%, or DLCO (SB) of 56-65% predicted
FEV-1 of 40-55% predicted, or FEV-1/FVC of 40-55%, or DLCO (SB) of 40-55% predicted, or maximum oxygen consumption of 15 to 20 ml/kg/min (with cardiorespiratory limit)

FEV-1 less than 40% predicted, or FEV-1/FVC less than 40%, or DLCO (SB) less than 40% predicted, or maximum exercise capacity less than 15 ml/kg/min oxygen consumption (with cardiac or respiratory limitation), or cor pulmonale (right heart failure), or right ventricular hypertrophy, or pulmonary hypertension, or episode(s) of acute respiratory failure, or requires outpatient oxygen therapy

conditions: Spinal cord injury with respiratory insufficiency (6841)

levels.criteria: FVC of 75-80% predicted, or DLCO (SB) of 66-80% predicted
FVC of 65-74% predicted, or DLCO (SB) of 56-65% predicted
FVC of 50-64% predicted, or DLCO (SB) of 40-55% predicted, or maximum exercise capacity of 15-20 ml/kg/min O2 consumption with cardiorespiratory limitation

FVC less than 50% predicted, or DLCO (SB) less than 40% predicted, or maximum exercise capacity less than 15 ml/kg/min O2 consumption with cardiorespiratory limitation, or cor pulmonale or pulmonary hypertension, or requires outpatient oxygen therapy

pft_testing.description: Pulmonary Function Tests are critical for rating
pft_testing.rating_note: Post-bronchodilator results used unless pre-bronchodilator results are more favorable

pact_act_burn_pits.description: PACT Act made many respiratory conditions presumptive for burn pit exposure
pact_act_burn_pits.qualifying_service: Service in covered locations under PACT Act

agent_orange.description: Certain respiratory conditions presumptive for herbicide exposure

common_connections.connection: Aspiration can worsen or cause respiratory problems
Upper airway conditions affect lower airways

tips_for_veterans: Bring ALL pulmonary function test results
Document all medications - inhalers, nebulizers, steroids
Track frequency of exacerbations requiring treatment
Report any emergency room visits for breathing
Mention if you use or need supplemental oxygen
Describe activities limited by breathing problems
Document burn pit or toxic exposure history
Report frequency of rescue inhaler use
common_mistakes: Not having recent PFT results available
Not reporting exacerbations and ER visits
important_notes: PFT results are primary basis for rating
Post-bronchodilator results used unless pre is more favorable
PACT Act made many conditions presumptive for burn pit exposure
Oxygen therapy requirement generally supports 100% rating
Keep detailed records of all treatments and exacerbations
Multiple respiratory conditions may be rated together
